thread.section_title: Brexit can go ahead after House of Lords votes bill through – Metro
thread.title: Brexit can go ahead after House of Lords votes bill through
thread.title_full: Brexit can go ahead after House of Lords votes bill through

author: Jen
title: Brexit can go ahead after House of Lords votes bill through
text:
MPs rejected the amendments tonight (Picture: Getty) The House of Lords has voted the Brexit Bill through without making changes, meaning Brexit can go ahead. 
Peers had tried to pass amendments protecting the rights of EU citizens currently in the UK, and demanding a ‘meaningful’ vote in parliament.
But MPs voted to overturn their changes to the bill today.
They sent the bill back to the Lords to try to get it through again, and this time peers dropped their opposition.
It has cleared the Lords unamended allowing the Prime Minister to begin talks on a divorce deal for leaving the EU.
The unamended bill allows ministers to begin their negotiations with ‘no strings attached’, as Brexit Minister David Davies said earlier today.
More follows.
